titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Smith Papers
titlestmt.author: by Diane J. Ducharme

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday March 22, 2019 at 03:02
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: William Smith papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
The papers consist of letters, poems by both William Smith and others, newspaper clippings and other material related to Smith's career in the theater and his life in retirement after 1788. The letters discuss personal news, requests for theater tickets, inquiries after Smith's health, and other matters. Letters by Thomas Coutts offer his opinion on various aspiring actors and gossip about theatrical personages; William Dolben's letters include drafts of epilogues and odes; Capel Lofft's letters contain comments on Garrick and Roscius. Edmund Kean's letter discusses his performances of Richard III.
Other papers include a list of characters performed by Smith at Drury Lane, 1753-88; his farewell address from there, 1788; miscellaneous verses; and memorabilia of David Garrick.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William Smith Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Smith Papers. James Marshall and Marie Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained.

bioghist.head: WILLIAM SMITH (1730?-1819)
bioghist.p: William Smith, known during his theatrical career as "Gentleman" Smith, was born in London, educated at Eton, and admitted to St. John's College, Cambridge. In 1767, after leaving Cambridge following an incident during which he drew a pistol on the proctor, Smith returned to London, became a pupil of Spranger Barry, and made his first appearance as the title hero in Nathaniel Lee's Theodosius at Covent Garden in January, 1753. In the following year Smith married Elizabeth Montagu Courtenay, the second daughter of viscount Hinchingbroke and sister of the fourth Earl of Sandwich. The family objected strongly to the match, and Smith reportedly offered to retire from acting were he guaranteed an annuity equal to his earnings. Elizabeth Smith died in 1762; Smith subsequently married a widow named Margaret.

In the spring of 1774, Smith ended his career at Covent Garden in the role of Macbeth, announcing his intention to retire and to devote himself to a country life in Bury St. Edmunds. Instead, he went to Paris with Mrs. Hartley, who had been playing opposite him as Lady Macbeth. Several months later he returned to England and to his second wife, and joined Garrick's Drury Lane Theatre. He appeared there until his retirement in 1788, winning particular fame for his interpretation of Charles Surface in Sheridan's School for Scandal , a role he originated.

Upon retiring, Smith did settle at Bury St. Edmunds, returning to the stage only once, to perform Charles Surface in a benefit at Covent Garden. He devoted himself to fox-hunting and horseracing, and died at home in 1819.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William Smith Papers document aspects of the adult life and theatrical career of the actor "Gentleman" William Smith. The papers span the dates 1760-1823, and are organized into Correspondence, Poems, and Personal Papers series.

Series I, Correspondence
, is located in folders 1-47 and arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Retained copies of letters by William Smith have been listed under Smith alphabetically by recipient.

Letters concerning Smith's life in the theater and English theater in general include those by Sir George Beaumont, George Frederick Cooke, Thomas Coutts, Joseph George Holman, Edmund Kean, Thomas King, Capel Lofft, and Viscount Torrington. Kean's letter includes a discussion of his approach to the role of Richard III, while Beaumont's letters contain comments on the "Garrick School" of acting and anecdotes about the theater. The letters of William Dolben, Smith's schoolfellow, contain many compositions and Latin translation exercises as well as school and family news.

Series II, Poems
, is organized into three subseries: "Addresses and Other Theatrical Pieces by William Smith," "Occasional Poems by William Smith" and "Poems by Others." "Addresses and Other Theatrical Pieces" includes manuscripts of prologues, epilogues and songs composed by Smith for his own performances, including his farewell epilogue and the epilogue he delivered after his post-retirement appearance in the role of Charles Surface at the King benefit. Folder 56 contains a song in honor of Nelson's victories in Egypt, "to the tune of'Hearts of Oak.'" "Occasional Poems" includes manuscripts of elegies, songs, and "The Death of Nelson--from the Greek."

Series III, Personal Papers
, includes material related to the King benefit performance; a list of roles performed by Smith from 1753 to 1788; and two folders of David Garrick memorabilia, such as an invitation to his funeral, tributes to him, and copies of anecdotes concerning him.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
Axford, John. ALS to the Rev. Mr. Barton, Warminster

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beaumont, Sir George Howland, 1753-1827

did.unittitle: 1 ALS and 1 copy (in Martha Smith's hand) to John Taylor, Coleorton Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beaumont's recollections about the character of William Smith, with comments about Taylor's article on Smith in the Sun .

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to Martha Smith, Grosvenor Square

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Expressions of pleasure at a book willed to Beaumont by William Smith.

did.unittitle: 8 ALS to William Smith, [v.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of letters with nostalgic comments about the Garrickean school of acting, entertaining anecdotes about the child actor William Betty and gracious references to many of the important men of the period. A draft of a Smith reply is on the back of the first letter.

did.unittitle: Braybrooke, Richard Aldworth Griffin-Neville, 2nd baron, 1750-1825. ALS to William Smith, Billingbean
Buccleuch, Charles William Henry Scott, 4th duke of, 1772-1819. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With draft of Smith's reply on reverse. Accompanied by another ALS (1 p., [1810]).

did.unittitle: Bunbury, Henry William, 1750-1811. ALS to William Smith, Keswick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by two riddles, 1808.

did.unittitle: Bute, Frances (Coutts) Stuart, Marchioness of, 1773-1832. ALS to William Smith, Naples

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Refers to her father, Thomas Coutts.

did.unittitle: Cooke, George Frederick, 1756-1811. ALS to William Smith, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the acting of various plays and reflects the life of an actor.

did.unittitle: Cotterell-Dormer, Clement, d. 1808. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns plans to travel together.

did.unittitle: Coutts, Thomas, 1735-1822
AL to Martha Smith, [n.p]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note upon receiving William Smith's mourning ring for Garrick from Mrs. Smith.

did.unittitle: 13 ALS to William Smith, [v.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Intimate correspondence with reminiscences about the theater and old friends, with incisive comments about young actors and political affairs.

did.unittitle: Coutts and Co., bankers. [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Statement to Martha Smith from 1820 July to 1823 Jan.

did.unittitle: Cullum, Sir Thomas Grey, 1741-1831. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A quite friendly, newsy letter reflecting the period.

did.unittitle: Cumberland, Richard, 1732-1811.
ALS to William Smith, Tunbridge Wells

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a copy of the letter from Smith to Cumberland, 1806 Mar 12. References to William Betty.

did.unittitle: Lines written by the late Mr. Cumberland a short time before his death. Manuscript copied by William Smith.
Derby, Edward Smith Stanley, 13th Earl of, 1775-1851. ALS to William Smith, The Oaks
DeTably, John Fleming Leicester, 1st Baron, 1762-1827. 2 ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]
Dolben, Sir John English, 4th Bart., ca. 1750-1837. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a Latin ode for Smith (1 p.).

did.unittitle: Dolben, William, 1726-1814. 18 ALS to William Smith, Bury St. Edmunds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These letters contain many poems and Latin translations. They are accompanied by a letter from Dolben's daughter to William Smith and by a poem of Smith.

did.unittitle: Erskine, Thomas Erskine, 1st baron, 1750-1823. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]
Genlis, Stéphanie Félicité Ducrest de Saint-Aubin, Comtesse de, 1746-1830. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: She presents her compliments and apologies.

did.unittitle: Holman, Joseph George, 1764-1817. ALS to William Smith, Hanover Square

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns Holman's statement of grievances of chief actors and his "Tribute to respect" to Smith.

did.unittitle: Hustler, James Devereux. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With copies of Greek and Latin inscriptions for a monument to Tweddell in Athens.

did.unittitle: Jeckyll, Joseph, d. 1837. Copy of a note to Mrs. Coutts (later Duchess of St. Albans), n.p.
Jordan, Dorothy (Bland), 1762-1816. 2 ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Refers to commemorative cup given to Thomas King; Smith has written a ballad on the reverse of the second letter.

did.unittitle: Kean, Edmund, 1787-1833. Letter (copy by William Smith) to Samuel Whitbread, Birmingham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns "flattering paneganic" by Whitbread, and also Kean's performance of Richard III.

did.unittitle: King, Thomas, 1730-1805. 3 ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of the letters concerns Sheridan's Pizarro . Accompanied by an address to the King, holograph, dated Theatre Royal Drury Lane, 1800 May 24, (1 p.).

did.unittitle: Lansdowne, Henry Petty-Fitzmaurice, 3rd Marquis of, 1780-1863. ALS to William Smith, Bolton Street
Lofft, Capell, 1751-1824. 3 ALS to William Smith, Troston

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reminiscences about the theater. One letter is in verse and is accompanied by transcription.

did.unittitle: Mansfield, Sir James, 1733-1821. ALS to William Smith, Queen Square

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mansfield was Lord Chief Justice. Smith has used the letter to write down horse race results.

did.unittitle: Nelson, Horatio Nelson, viscount, 1758-1805. Letter (copy) to Lord Stowell, Victory

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a copy of Lord Nelson's prayer, "composed while the enemy's fleets were in sight", 1805 Oct 21.

did.unittitle: Panton, Thomas, 1731-1808. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]
Portland, William Henry Cavendish Bentinck, 3d duke of, 1738-1809. ALS to William Smith, Bulstrode

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relates Portland's appreciation for Smith's suggestions concerning some affairs with France.

did.unittitle: Poyntz, William Stephen, ca. 1770-1840. ALS to Martha Smith, Petworth

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns part of William Smith's will.

did.unittitle: Sandwich, Elizabeth (Wilmot) Montagu, countess of, 1674-1757. ALS to Elizabeth Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letter appears to be dated 1714, but refers to her Grandson, who was not born until 1718.

did.unittitle: Smith, Pleasance (Reeve), Lady, 1773-1877. ALS to Martha Smith, Lowth Place
Smith, William, 1730?-1819
ALS to Sir George Beaumont, Bury St. Edmonds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This polite letter commences their long and pleasant correspondence.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to William Betty, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With a copy of a poem addressed to Betty.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to the Marchioness of Bute, [n.p.]
AL (in 3rd person) to the Eton Club, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mr. Smith mittit Salutem to the Eton Club.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Joseph Holman, Bury St. Edmonds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Answer to Holman's letter concerning a statement of grievances of chief actors.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Edmund Kean, Bury St. Edmunds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter of introduction for Doctor Malkin. The 26th anniversary of his quitting the stage.

did.unittitle: AL (copy) to Lord John Townshend, [n.p.]
Symonds, John, 1730-1807. AL to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enclosed are two poems by Thomas Grey: "On the election of the High Steward of the university, when the contest was between Ld. Sandwich & Ld. Hardwicke," and "Inscription for the Villa of a decayed Statesman on the sea-coast". Also a transcription of the poems in Smith's hand.

did.unittitle: Torrington, John Byng, 5th viscount, 1740-1813. ALS to William Smith, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On Smith's Epilogue, spoken after his last benefit at Drury Lane Theatre, of which Byng was co-author. Accompanied by two copies of the epilogue.

did.unittitle: Townshend, Lord John, 1757-1833. ALS to William Smith, Bath

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by another ALS (1806), discussing the sickness of C. J. Fox.

ADDRESSES AND OTHER THEATRICAL PIECES BY WILLIAM SMITH
Epilogue to the Tempest, performed at the Earl of Sandwichs at Hinchingbrooke, spoken by Miss Courtenay who performed the part of Ariel.

did.unittitle: POEMS BY OTHERS
Holographs, some annotated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are copies of "Prologue to Mr. Panton's Opera called 'The Trial'"; "Written on the Elopment of Lady Mary Singleton"; "Fragment of a Legendary Tale found in the Library of Holland House"; and a variety of occasional verses, epitaphs, and riddles annotated as sent to Smith or as copied from newspapers and magazines.

did.unittitle: Personal Papers
Benefit performance of School for Scandal for Mr. King, 1798 May

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes box ticket; playbill; holograph copy of review of Smith's performance from The Star ; and note by Mrs. Smith.

did.unittitle: Characters perform'd by Mr. Smith at the Theatre Royal Drury Lane and Covent Garden from the 8th of January 1753 ... to the 8th of June 1788.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph.

did.unittitle: Coat of arms of Smith of Kent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph.

did.unittitle: Collection of memorabilia of David Garrick collected by Wm Smith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are an invitation to Garrick's funeral, a tribute to Garrick by William Smith (holograph), an engraving of Garrick's arms, a copy of Garrick's verse letter to H. W. Bunbury (1774 Oct 5), "Mr. Anstey to Mr. Garrick on meeting him at a Friend's House" (with his reply), and anecdotes of Garrick.

did.unittitle: Epitaphs and obituaries
Geneaological and historical notes
Inventories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holographs. Includes plan of a wine cellar.

did.unittitle: Locks of hair
Newspaper clippings
Papers of Mrs. William Smith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a printed copy of "Ode to the Poppy, by Mrs. Smith" and a paper pattern heart and wrapper for a remedy sent to her by Lady Cullum.

did.unittitle: Printed material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of "Trout Hall"; "The Pilgrim's Prayer"; and an advertisement for "Pinetti's Capital Deceptions".

did.unittitle: Wrappers and franks
